subject: Re: Need common abbreviation list
msgSnippet: ... I believe the term Junior is overloaded to mean two things: 1. the version of quickscript one uses as a beginner 2. the version of quickscript need for
messageBody:
--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Paul Tremblay <phthenry@...> wrote:
>
>In some of these cases, it appears that Read recommends using senior QS
>letters, so should we try to use a Junior equivelent?
>


I believe the term Junior is overloaded to mean two things:

1. the version of quickscript one uses as a beginner
2. the version of quickscript need for typographic representation.

Definition number two certainly allows the use of everything in the
senior section of the QM except letter connection. i.e. the rules for
abbreviations, standard spellings and morphemic writing. Therefore IMO
it is fine to use full size QS letters where the manual shows half
letters.


ENGLISH, quick script (ascii mapping of qs letters)

MRS, mrz
MR, mr
DR, dar
THE, H
OF, v
AND, n
TO, t
IT, i
IS, z
FOR, f
BE, b
AN, an
ALWAYS, Ylwaz
IN, in
NONE, nan
OFF, of
OUR, Qr
THAT, Ht
THEIR, HEr
THEIRS, HErz
THERE, HEr
THEY'RE, HEr
USE, jMz
ALSO, Yls
ARE, r
AS, A
BE, b
BEING, bN
BEEN, bn
BECAUSE, bkz
BEFORE, bf
BUT, bt
CAN, k
CAN'T, knt
CANNOT, kAnot
COME, km
COMES, kmz
COMING, kmN
COULD, kd
COULDN'T, kdnt
DO, d
DID, dd
DON'T, dnt
DIDN'T, ddnt
EVER, ev
EVERY, evi
FROM, fm
GO, g
GOING, gN
GONE, gn
GOOD, gd
HAVE, hv
HAVEN'T, hvnt
HE, h
HIM, hm
HIS, hz
INTO, int
ITS, is
IT'S, is
LITTLE, lil
MAKE, mk
MAKING, mkN
MADE, md
ME, m
MUCH, mc
NEVER, nev
OFTEN, ofn
ON, o
ONLY, Oni
PEOPLE, ppl
PERHAPS, pps
SHALL, Sl
SHOULD, Sd
SHE, S
SO, s
THAN, Hn
THESE, Hz
THINK, T
THINKING, TN
THOUGHT, Tt
THIS, Hs
TIME, tm
TIMES, tmz
VERY, vr
WE, w
WHAT, `
WHATEVER, `ev
WHICH, c
WILL, l
WITH, wi
WITHOUT, wiQt
WOULD, wd
WOULDN'T, wdnt
YOU, j
YOUR, jr
YOURS, jrz


All the standard spellings that I omitted already come out correctly
using the CMU.
